question.text: Which pair of the following belongs to Basidiomycetes?

solution.text:
Birds nest fungi (Cyathus), puffballs (Lycoperdon). Mushrooms (Agaricus), Stink horn - Basidiomycetes
Claviceps, Peziza, MorchellaAscomycetes
Related Theory
In Ascomycetes, asexual reproduction involves the production of conidiospore. During sexual reproduction, the ascocarp undergo meiosis to form ascospores. The lifecycle of basidiomycetes includes alternation of generations. Spores are generally produced through sexual reproduction, rather than asexual reproduction. The clubshaped basidium carries basidiospores. The Deuteromycetes use strictly asexual reproduction only (sexual reproduction absent). Zygomycetes reproduce asexually by producing sporangiospores. Sexual reproduction occurs by conjugation and form zygospores.
